title: 15 NFL experts make second-half predictions: Division-race shockers, MVP picks and record breakers
content: Can the Bucs reach the Super Bowl? Will Myles Garrett win DPOY? We asked 15 experts to give their predictions for the rest of the NFL season.

title: Sources: No surgery for Commanders QB Daniels
content: Commanders quarterback Jayden Daniels has no ligament damage in his dislocated left elbow and will not need surgery, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: Japanese home run king Murakami posts
content: Japanese star third baseman Munetaka Murakami, who owns the single-season home run record for a Japanese player in Nippon Professional Baseball, is entering the posting system for MLB teams, sources told ESPN.

title: Ex-WR Brown arrested in Dubai, extradited to U.S.
content: Former NFL star Antonio Brown has been arrested on an attempted murder charge stemming from a shooting after a celebrity boxing event in Miami in May.

title: Broncos admit offense lagging following ugly win
content: Broncos running back J.K. Dobbins was among several players who acknowledged the offense isn't doing the defense "any justice" after an ugly 10-7 win over the Raiders.

title: Sources: OF Tucker among 13 to get $22M offer
content: Kyle Tucker (Cubs) and Kyle Schwarber (Phillies) headline the 13 players who were tendered the $22.025 million qualifying offer, sources told ESPN.

title: Jones enters not guilty plea in NBA gambling case
content: Former NBA player and assistant coach Damon Jones pleaded not guilty to charges he profited from rigged poker games and provided sports bettors with nonpublic information about injuries to stars LeBron James and Anthony Davis.

title: Gators' 7-9 Rioux becomes tallest college player
content: Olivier Rioux, Florida's 7-foot-9 center, became the tallest person ever to play college basketball when he made his debut in a 104-64 victory over North Florida.

title: Odunze: Dad's shots at Bears don't speak for me
content: Bears wide receiver Rome Odunze says his father's social media posts are his prerogative but that they don't speak for him.

title: üèÄ Latest NBA intel on futures of Ja, Zion, Trae
content: How close are the Grizz, Pelicans and Hawks to trading their stars? Is Giannis Watch over? Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst have the latest.

content: A trip to Sombor, Serbia, paints a portrait of the elusive Nuggets star by the people who know him best.

title: Sizing up BYU-Texas Tech, A&M-Mizzou, Oregon-Iowa and 25 other key showdowns
content: A top-10 meeting in Lubbock, an upset bid in Iowa City and a pair of SEC tests headline the weekend slate.

title: Texas Tech's $7M offseason overhaul paying off
content: The nation's leader in sacks is just the tip of the spear when it comes to the Red Raiders' work in the portal.

title: Inside the Jets' shocking deadline-day trades of Sauce Gardner, Quinnen Williams
content: With much of the Jets organization at Nick Mangold's funeral, two big trades were in the works two miles away.

title: High expectations, mixed results: Why North Carolina is entering a pivotal season
content: The Tar Heels' prestigious past can't guarantee a prestigious future. Here's what that means for their season.

title: Cowboys' Kneeland dies in apparent suicide at 24
content: Dallas Cowboys defensive end Marshawn Kneeland died Thursday morning from an apparent suicide following a police pursuit and vehicle crash, according to authorities.

title: Mile High Misery: Broncos' pass rush too much for Geno Smith, Raiders
content: The Broncos' league-leading pass rush dropped Smith six times, helping Denver to a seventh straight victory.

title: Early takeaways: Hidalgo is Notre Dame's singular star, UConn can run it back
content: UConn? As good as expected. Tennessee? Still chasing elite status. And Notre Dame? Heavily reliant on Hannah Hidalgo.

content: Two former champions will go for their second titles at UFC 322, giving their new divisions extra firepower.

title: The good, the bad and the ugly: Are Liverpool back to their best?
content: Liverpool have looked like both world beaters and distant also-rans in 2025-26, but after a tumultuous summer, the Reds may have just turned a corner.

title: After 2024-25 nightmare, Man City can prove spooky season is over
content: The woes of last season are starting to fade, but a clash with Liverpool will show whether City can contend.

title: What to know ahead of Brazilian Grand Prix sprint weekend
content: Formula 1 has reached round 21 and heads to Interlagos, Brazil for the S√£o Paulo Grand Prix. Everything you need to know for the upcoming sprint weekend.

title: Week 10 betting guide: Ravens continue ascent, plus more game bets and props galore
content: Our experts dive in to the lines and player props that offer value for Week 10, and share their tips and bets.

title: Want Wemby or Trey Murphy III? Now is the time to shoot your shot
content: Steve Alexander highlights fantasy basketball names trending upwards or downwards, with key takeaways for each.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Rodrygo, Yildiz on Spurs' radar
content: Real Madrid's Rodrygo and Juventus' Kenan Yildiz are part of Tottenham Hotspur's ambitious transfer plans. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Over 1,400 Africans From Dozens Of Countries Fighting For Russia: Ukraine
content: More than 1,400 citizens from three dozen African countries are fighting alongside Russian forces in Ukraine, Kyiv's foreign minister said on Friday.

title: Clandestine Nuclear Activities In Line With Pakistan's History: India
content: India on Friday noted US President Donald Trump's comments about Pakistan testing nuclear weapons and said Islamabad's "clandestine" nuclear activities were centred around decades of smuggling, export control violations and secret partnerships.

title: Rate Of Digital Frauds Rising Since July: RBI Deputy Governor
content: Reserve Bank Deputy Governor T Rabi Sankar on Friday said that the incidence of digital frauds has been rising since July this year.

title: Promised 60% Profit From Gold Trading, Kerala Man Defrauded Of Rs 95 Lakh
content: The Cyber Crime Police in Kerala's Malappuram arrested two key suspects in a Rs 95 lakh fraud case, where a school teacher was duped with promises of high returns through online gold trading.

title: "Aim To Free Seemanchal Of Illegal Immigrants": Amit Shah To NDTV In Bihar
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah today told NDTV the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) will sweep Bihar and that is evident from the huge crowds that turned up at every rally.

title: "People Voted For Change": Tejashwi Yadav To NDTV On Record Polling In Bihar
content: The people of Bihar voted for change in large numbers, and that has led to the state seeing the highest ever turnout in the assembly election, Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav told NDTV's Editor-in-Chief Rahul Kanwal.

title: US Ignored Pakistan's Nuclear Program Despite Warnings: Ex-CIA Officer
content: According to ex-CIA intelligence officer Richard Barlow, the then-US President Ronald Reagan administration prioritised its Afghan strategy over non-proliferation efforts.

title: Mexico President's Rivals Accuse Her Of Using Groping Row As Diversion Tactic
content: The groping of Mexico President on a street shone a bright light on the gender violence women face every day, but the country's political polarisation has tarnished what under other circumstances would seem a natural moment for national solidarity.

title: Kerala Orders Ban On Chemical Kumkum, Plastic Shampoo Sachets At Sabarimala
content: The Kerala High Court on Friday directed the Travancore Devaswom Board (TDB) to take immediate steps to ban the sale of chemical kumkum at Sabarimala, citing concerns over environmental degradation during the annual pilgrimage season.

title: Beheaded Body Of 17-Year-Old Girl Found In Jharkhand
content: The beheaded body of a 17-year-old girl was found in Jharkhand's Dumka district, police said on Friday.

title: Ex-CIA Officer's Claim On Secret India-Israel Plan To Strike Pak Nuke Site
content: Former CIA officer Richard Barlow revealed that the proposed joint covert operation by India and Israel to bomb Pakistan's Kahuta nuclear facility in the early 1980s to halt Islamabad's atomic ambition could have "solved a lot of problems."

title: J&K Bypolls: Omar Abdullah's Prestige Battle Amid Challenges Within, Without
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah hit the campaign trail in Budgam today, the Assembly seat he had vacated last year.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Who, Really, Is A 'Ghuspaithiya' In Bengal?
content: The 'naturalisation' of people who fled across the border before and after the creation of Bangladesh in 1971 has been a process in which the Congress, the CPI(M) and the Trinamool Congress have all been involved.

title: US Sold Sniper Rifles To Brazil Police Unit Linked To Deadly Rio Raids
content: The US government approved a sale of sniper rifles to a deadly police unit in Brazil last year, overriding concerns from the US ambassador and other diplomats that the arms could be used in extrajudicial killings.

title: Cost Of Home-Cooked Thalis Fell By Up To 17% In October. Here's Why
content: The cost of home-cooked vegetarian and non-vegetarian thalis fell as much as 17 per cent and 12 per cent (year-on-year) in October, respectively, primarily because of a steep decline in the prices of vegetables and pulses, a Crisil report said.

title: India, New Zealand Working To Conclude Trade Deal Early: Piyush Goyal
content: India and New Zealand look forward to working towards the early conclusion of a balanced, comprehensive and mutually beneficial trade agreement, in line with the growing strategic and economic convergence, said Piyush Goyal

title: Pakistan Developed Nuclear Weapons To Counter India: Ex CIA Officer
content: Pakistan's primary motive for developing nuclear weapons was to counter India, said former CIA officer Richard Barlow.

title: Former Kerala Congress MLA Anil Akkara Charged For Destroying Road Divider
content: A former Congress MLA Anil Akkara faces police case for allegedly damaging a road divider in Kerala's Thrissur district on Friday.

title: BJP To Launch "Trust-Building" Muslim Outreach Programme In Kerala
content: The BJP in Kerala on Friday said it will be starting a programme to reach out to the Muslim community in the state but clarified it was "not political or for getting votes"; instead, it was a "trust-building" initiative.

title: Video: QR Code Scam At Parking Lot Goes Viral. Paytm, Razorpay Founders React
content: A video of what looks like a scam at a parking lot, operating under the guise of the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD), has gone viral on social media.

title: SIR: over 3.21 lakh enumeration forms distributed in Ernakulam in four days
content: The forms have been distributed to 12.11% of the total voters in the district as on October 27, says District Collector

title: First phase alignment of Thiruvananthapuram metro rail approved
content: Panel finds revised alignment from Pappanamcode to Eenchakkal adhering to Central directive by effectively covering the Thiruvananthapuram North railway station and the airport. Following this, State government accords in-principle approval for the alignment after a detailed scrutiny

title: Laksha Deepotsavam in Nellore, a huge draw
content: Sea of lamps and spiritual fervour mark Kartheeka celebrations; Chaganti Koteswara Rao lauds VPR Foundation‚Äôs ‚ÄòNetra‚Äô initiative

title: Ajit Pawar says Pune land deal involving son Parth cancelled
content: On November 6, the ‚Çπ300 crore deal for the sale of 40 acres of government land in the upscale Mundhwa area to Amadea Enterprises LLP came under the scanner, as it was alleged that the land could not have been sold without the government's permission

title: Women‚Äôs SHGs powering Telangana‚Äôs 1-crore crorepati dream
content: With new incentives, subsidies and structured support through programmes like Indira Mahila Shakti, RAMP and WE-Hub, the government is building an ecosystem where micro-enterprises can scale and women can build wealth on their own terms, even as small self-help groups formalise businesses, access capital and step into sectors that were once beyond their reach

title: A normal home, a unique idea: Group living initiative in Hyderabad gives special-needs persons a life of choice
content: Five community homes in northern Hyderabad are reshaping what adulthood and independence can mean for people with special needs by offering real routines, real responsibilities and real freedom, supported by caregivers and a campus that builds skills for life and work

title: MCH bogged down by patients, staff inadequacies
content: While hospital officials assert that Venu received appropriate medical attention according to established protocols, the incident highlights systemic issues, such as overcrowding and shortage of staff, at the MCH.

title: Kerala launches drive to ensure passenger safety on trains
content: Seventy-two cases registered for various violations under the drive launched by the Kerala Railway Police and Railway Protection Force

title: 12 Telangana residents to return from Myanmar cyber scam hub
content: Telangana police officials have reached Delhi to assist with documentation, language support and travel coordination

title: Pawan Kalyan calls for speedy alignment of rural roads with GeoSadak
content: The move will help in real-time tracking of road conditions, says the Deputy CM and asks officials to speed up works of 662 roads connecting 761 tribal villages

title: Congress rebel A.V. Gopinathan to ally with LDF in Peringottukurissi
content: Former Palakkad DCC chief says he and his supporters will contest the local body elections under the Independent Development Front banner

title: Job aspirants withdraw protest after Minister Ramalinga Reddy‚Äôs assurance
content: Hundreds of candidates who were shortlisted in the 2019 recruitment for drivers and driver-cum-conductors in North Western Karnataka Road Transport Corporation, staged a protest in Hubballi on Friday seeking recruitment for all the notified posts and withdrew it later in the day following specific assurance by Transport Minister Ramalinga Reddy

title: CRPF Delhi Group Centre marks 150th anniversary of Vande Mataram
content: Event at CRPF Group Centre in New Delhi highlights national pride, unity, and cultural significance of Vande Mataram

title: No red-carpet welcome for women in power, says former Kochi Mayor Soumini Jain
content: Ms. Jain of the UDF was the second woman to hold the post, following the LDF‚Äôs Mercy Williams, who served from 2005 to 2010

title: CPI(M) flags covert UDF-Jamaat-e-Islami alliance in crucial election year
content: The Jamaat-e-Islami‚Äôs ideology is gaining traction in the UDF, says Govindan. The IUML, he claims, has opened the door for Jamaat-e-Islami‚Äôs insidious attempt to steer UDF politics from behind the curtains

title: Niti Aayog member flags R&D, talent, and funding gaps in India‚Äôs march towards ‚ÄòViksit Bharat 2047‚Äô
content: V.K. Saraswat seeks stronger industry-academia linkages, higher R&D spending, and STEM reforms to power innovation-led growth

title: Sivankutty moots unified, secular school prayer
content: Curtain goes up on State school science festival in Palakkad; BJP municipal councillor Mini Krishnakumar walks out of the inaugural function protesting against Rahul Mamkootathil‚Äôs presence

title: Kilimanoor block panchayat in Kerala launches its own rice brand
content: Paddy is procured from farmers in eight grama panchayats under the block panchayat and processed in its rice mill. KMR Rice was launched in local markets this week

title: Kerala University research scholar lodges police complaint alleging caste-based discrimination by HoD
content: He seeks steps to register a case under the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Act alleging that Prof. C.N. Vijayakumari made casteist remarks and obstructed his research progress

title: Jubilee Hills bypoll result to decide future of 4-crore TG people, says Harish Rao
content: He alleges that flight of investment, rise in crime rate, drug menace, demolition of houses of poor have become hallmarks of Congress rule

title: Senna spectabilis removed from 1,963 hectares of land in Mudumalai Tiger Reserve
content: These trees have been identified on a total of 2,448 hectares, and we have removed 80% of the trees so far. They do not help in biodiversity and are not liked by animals either. The cut trees are being used for making paper, says¬†Supriya¬†Sahu, Secretary, Environment, Climate Change and Forests

title: KSRTC to operate 1,750 buses in three phases for Sabarimala pilgrimage
content: The services to the hill temple will be arranged without upsetting the operations to other parts of the State. The utility will also arrange chartered services from temples.

title: Tourists can now walk along the Idukki and Cheruthoni dams
content: Visitors must follow tight security guidelines while touring the dams, says Water Resources Minister

title: A.P. SIPB clears investment proposals worth ‚Çπ1.01 lakh crore
content: Advocating maintenance of an industrial land bank, CM says IAS officers will be appointed to oversee development of the State's three economic corridors

title: Nearly 1,200 applications received for B-Khata to A-Khata conversions: GBA Chief
content: The conversion campaign, which officially began on November 1, was announced by the Karnataka government on October 15 with the aim of regularising property records, easing property tax collection, and making property transactions more transparent and legally compliant

title: Ministry of Fisheries urged to encourage shrimp processing plants in West Godavari district
content: Detailed Project Reports seeking required assistant from the National Fisheries Development Board, NABARD, and the Indian Council of Agriculture Research to encourage Brackishwater aquaculture and exports are being prepared, says the Collector

title: Trial courts have no power to decide legality of Look Out Circulars: Karnataka HC
content: If the trial courts are found interfering with the LOCs, such action would be viewed seriously, the High Court said after it was brought to its notice that trial courts are interfering in LOCs in several instances

title: Wildlife panel clears 13 defence, paramilitary projects in Ladakh, Arunachal
content: In Ladakh, several major defence projects were approved inside the Changthang Cold Desert and Karakoram (Nubra-Shayok) wildlife sanctuaries

title: Cooperation sought for further improving ‚Äòsports ambience‚Äô in Dharwad
content: Reiterating the State government‚Äôs commitment in creating more infrastructure to encourage children to take interest in sports, Labour Minister and Dharwad district in charge Santosh Lad has sought the cooperation of everyone to further improve the ‚Äòsports ambience‚Äô in the district

title: High Court dismisses Haryana ex-CM Hooda's plea for postponing trial proceedings in Manesar land deal case
content: More than seven years ago, Mr. Hooda and some others had been charged by the CBI in a case of alleged corruption in Manesar land deals worth over ‚Çπ1,500 crore, in which around 200 farmers were allegedly cheated.

title: TTD accused of turning a blind eye to the menace of Illegal hawkers in Tirumala
content: Despite the Chief Minister‚Äôs instructions, the temple administration is yet to act tough and clear the unauthorised hawkers and pavement dwellers in the temple town, alleges Tirumala Parirakshana Sainyam

title: Provide all necessary facilities to hostel students, says human rights commission member
content: Karnataka State Human Rights Commission judicial member Suresh Vantigodi directed officials to ensure that all children residing in government-run hostels receive every facility extended to them under government schemes and that no student faces any hardship

title: CPI(M) State Secretariat recommends reconstitution of TDB
content: Party reportedly favours former Chief Secretary K. Jayakumar for the post of TDB president over other names, factoring in his impeccable track record as a bureaucrat and his experience serving twice as Special Commissioner (TDB) while weighing his name for the post

title: Pilot health project in Kuppam sets model for Statewide rollout
content: Health Ministry official commends Kuppam initiative for improving rural healthcare delivery; orientation and training drives planned to enhance field-level services

title: More buses to NWKRTC, promises Transport Minister  Ramalinga Reddy
content: Transport Minister Ramalinga Reddy has said that in addition to the 700 new buses provided to NWKRTC, tender had been floated for purchase of 300 new buses and sanction had been given for 150 buses

title: KIA handled 32.4 million passengers in the first nine months of 2025
content: The airport handled domestic passenger traffic of 27.3 million and international passenger traffic of 5.1 million in the first nine months of 2025, representing year over year growth of 5% and 30.1%, respectively

title: Maharashtra sends proposal to Centre to relocate 50 leopards to Vantara
content: Forest department seeks CZA approval to shift rescued leopards to Ambani-owned Vantara facility in Jamnagar

title: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister orders clearance of encroachments in KRS backwaters
content: Deputy Chief Minister and Water Resources Minister D.K. Shivakumar has ordered the Deputy Commissioners of Mandya and Mysuru districts and the managing director of Cauvery Neeravari Nigama Ltd. to conduct a survey and immediately clear encroachments in the backwaters of the Krishnaraja Sagar and submit a report after marking the boundary stones

title: Vande Mataram at 150: How musicians have kept the national song alive
content: From classical ragas to contemporary rhythms, artistes across generations have reimagined the national song, keeping its spirit vibrant and relevant.

title: Headmistress suspended over unclean toilets
content: District Education Officer (DEO) Venkateshwarulu was directed to replace the sanitation staff in the school

title: Patriotic fervour marks 150 years of Vande Mataram in Chittoor, Puttaparthi
content: The celebration of India‚Äôs national song brings together students, officials, and the public, highlighting the enduring legacy of unity and sacrifice

title: TTD to soon announce release dates of Vaikunta Dwara Darshan tickets
content: We are committed to a fair and pilgrim-friendly system of token issuance for the 10-day festival commencing December 30, 2025, says Executive Officer Anil Kumar Singhal; the online tokens for ‚ÄòAnga Pradakshinam‚Äô will be made available on first come, first served basis, he adds

title: Governor Jishnu Dev Varma urges Satavahana University to strive for NAAC accreditation and NIRF ranking
content: To every rural student before me ‚Äî your journey is living proof that merit thrives in modest beginnings, and perseverance remains the greatest equalizer, the Governor said in his Convocation Address

title: 'Islamic bomb': Ex-CIA officer reveals what drove Pak to build nukes; makes big Indira claim
content: Former CIA officer Richard Barlow revealed Pakistan's nuclear program evolved from countering India to creating an "Islamic bomb" for Muslim nations, driven by A.Q. Khan. Barlow also criticized US "negligence" in addressing Pakistan's nuclear dealings for decades. India maintains a No First Use policy, unlike Pakistan.

title: 'Land deal cancelled': Ajit Pawar says son didn't know it was govt property; probe on
content: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar confirmed the cancellation of a land deal involving his son, Parth Pawar, amid allegations of irregularities. Pawar asserted his and his office's non-involvement, emphasizing transparency. The government has formed a committee to probe the matter, with an FIR already registered. Strict action will follow if wrongdoing is established.

title: ‚ÄòWe are on same page‚Äô: Tej Pratap meets Ravi Kishan at airport - will he join NDA?
content: Janshakti Janata Dal founder Tej Pratap Yadav and BJP MP Ravi Kishan were seen together at Patna airport, fueling speculation during Bihar's election season. Yadav, expelled from RJD, stated their shared devotion to Lord Shiva and hinted at aligning with anyone addressing unemployment. Kishan emphasized the BJP's openness to devotees of Bholenath.

title: '44 Indians in Russian army': MEA in touch with Kremlin; issues serious warning
content: India has identified 44 nationals serving in the Russian Army amid the Ukraine conflict and urged Moscow for their release. The Ministry of External Affairs is coordinating with Russian authorities and affected families, warning citizens against dangerous recruitment offers. This comes as families protest, seeking government intervention for their relatives allegedly misled into fighting.

title: Trillionaire, billionaire, socialist: Musk, Trump, Mamdani - what's going on in US
content: New York City elected democratic socialist Zohran Mamdani as mayor, promising progressive policies. Meanwhile, Tesla shareholders approved a massive pay package for CEO Elon Musk, potentially making him the world's first trillionaire. These events highlight a divided America, with the billionaire class ascending while the working class demands change.

title: Ford CEO questions Apple‚Äôs CarPlay: Warns of overreach; questions Tim Cook
content: Ford CEO Jim Farley expressed strong concerns about Apple's CarPlay Ultra, fearing it encroaches too deeply into vehicle control. He questioned how far Apple's brand should extend into car functions, emphasizing the digital experience as a key differentiator for future vehicles. This follows similar reservations from other automakers and GM's decision to drop both CarPlay and Android Auto.

title: 'Thousands have committed suicide': Raina, Dhawan slammed in betting case
content: Hyderabad Police Commissioner V. C. Sajjanar questioned former cricketers Suresh Raina and Shikhar Dhawan's role model status after the ED seized their assets worth Rs 11.14 crore in a betting platform probe. He highlighted the devastating impact of betting addiction on youth, urging celebrities to avoid promoting such platforms and instead guide society positively.

title: Rs 4 lakh per month not enough! SC issues notice to Shami after estranged wife's plea
content: The Supreme Court has issued a notice to cricketer Mohammad Shami, asking him to respond to his estranged wife Hasin Jahan's plea for increased interim maintenance. She argues the Calcutta High Court's awarded amounts are inadequate given his substantial income and lavish lifestyle, seeking significantly higher sums for herself and their daughter.

title: Indian student in Chicago: How rejection turned into success; a story of courage
content: Master's student Zeel Patel strategically navigated her study abroad journey by rejecting initial offers to reflect on her goals. She then applied to fewer, more focused programs, securing admission to the University of Chicago. Her experience highlights the importance of deliberate choices, proactive engagement, and building genuine connections for academic and personal growth.

title: JP Morgan CEO‚Äôs phone rule: Jamie Dimon doesn‚Äôt carry phone in office; calls it 'distraction'
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon enforces a strict "smartphone rule," rarely carrying his mobile during work hours to maintain undivided focus in meetings. He emphasizes that urgent matters require a call to his office, not texts or emails, as he actively avoids digital distractions. Dimon believes this approach is crucial for effective engagement and respect in professional settings.

title: Rare earth fight: India to be key supplier? How Xi-Trump pact will help
content: India is poised to become a major force in the global rare-earth market. A recent trade agreement provides a crucial window for New Delhi to boost its processing and manufacturing. With rich mineral reserves and strong political backing, India can establish itself as a vital hub. This development offers a path to diversify supply chains and enhance global resilience.

title: 'Samson has lost his spot': Ex-India batter drops bombshell; explains team's pecking order
content: Former cricketer Mohammad Kaif expressed doubts about Sanju Samson's T20I future, suggesting he's been sidelined due to Shubman Gill's grooming as a future captain. Kaif noted Jitesh Sharma is now preferred as a finisher, despite Samson's strong record. This shift towards role-specific selections appears to have impacted Samson's place in the evolving team dynamics.

title: Jeff Bezos‚Äô ex-wife‚Äôs gift: MacKenzie Scott makes large donation; focus on education
content: MacKenzie Scott has gifted Howard University $80 million, one of the largest single donations in its history, to support general operations and its College of Medicine. This significant contribution arrives as the university faces delays in federal funding due to a government shutdown. The donation continues Scott's recent pattern of substantial gifts to diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives.

title: TMC MP falls prey to cyberfraud: Kalyan Banerjee loses Rs 56 lakh; KYC forged
content: Trinamool MP Kalyan Banerjee has reportedly lost Rs 56 lakh from a dormant bank account linked to his past tenure as an MLA. Fraudsters allegedly used his photo and mobile number to siphon funds from the account, which had been inactive for years. The bank authorities themselves alerted the MP and filed a cybercrime complaint.

title: Over 800 flights hit: Technical snag triggers chaos at Delhi, Mumbai airports - key points
content: Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport faced significant disruption Friday as a glitch in the Automatic Message Switching System (AMSS) led to over 800 flight delays. Air traffic controllers were forced to revert to manual procedures, drastically slowing down operations. Airlines issued advisories, urging passengers to check revised schedules and expect longer waits as teams worked to restore the system.

title: Handshake drama! Hostilities continue as India beat Pakistan
content: India and Pakistan cricketers continued their trend of skipping handshakes after their recent Hong Kong Sixes clash, following a pattern set during the Asia Cup and Women's World Cup. In this match, India secured a narrow victory via the DLS method. This avoidance of post-match pleasantries stems from heightened political tensions and past incidents, with players adhering to established norms.

title: Pak's hypocrisy exposed! PM Sharif's aide visits office of Hafiz Saeed's outfit
content: Pakistan's duplicity on terrorism is evident as a federal minister visited the political wing of Hafiz Saeed's banned Jamaat-ud-Dawah. Talal Chaudhry met with leaders of the Pakistan Markazi Muslim League, sparking outrage over apparent official patronage of a terror-linked organization. This visit normalizes banned extremist outfits amidst renewed tensions with India.

title: ‚ÄòCong means Muslims ‚Ä¶': BJP leader targets Reddy; accuses him of 'appeasement politics'
content: Union minister Bandi Sanjay Kumar criticizes Congress for appeasement politics before the Jubilee Hills by-poll. He claims Hindus in the constituency are supporting the BJP. Kumar alleges Congress is pandering to Muslim voters and calls the party the 'Indian Muslim Congress'. He urges the Hindu community to consolidate votes for the BJP in the upcoming election.

title: IPL: Thala, one more time! MS Dhoni set for another season with CSK
content: Chennai Super Kings CEO Kasi Viswanathan expressed strong optimism about MS Dhoni featuring in the 2026 IPL season.  Dhoni, a long-standing icon for the franchise, was retained as an uncapped player for Rs 4 crore. His continued presence is anticipated to be crucial for CSK's strategic direction following a challenging recent season.

title: Marshawn Kneeland tragedy: 'Goodbye' text exposes NFL mental-health crisis
content: Marshawn Kneeland‚Äôs death at 24 has forced the NFL to confront a serious mental health crisis. Police confirmed the Dallas Cowboys defensive end died by an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound after alarming messages to family. Coaches, teammates, and fans are grieving as dispatch audio reveals the severity of his final hours. Full details inside.

title: 'US has enough nuclear to blow up world 150 times': Trump says 'we are number 1'; ranks world powers
content: President Trump reiterated his claim of having enough nuclear weapons to "blow up the world 150 times," emphasizing his goal of denuclearization. He stated that the U.S. leads in nuclear capabilities, followed by Russia and China, and suggested leaders like Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin would redirect funds from weapons programs. Trump also confirmed the U.S.

title: How chaos at Mumbai's CMST forced commuters onto tracks; 2 killed by local train
content: Mumbai's Central Railway faced severe disruption as a railway employee protest at CSMT led to overcrowded platforms and stalled trains. Commuters, desperate to get home, walked on tracks near Sandhurst Road, resulting in a tragic accident where two died and three were injured. The protest stemmed from an FIR against engineers in a prior fatal accident.

title: 'Became PM by stealing elections': Rahul targets Modi; vows to reveal truth to Gen Z
content: Rahul Gandhi accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi of "stealing elections" and vowed to expose this to Gen Z. He presented evidence from the Election Commission, alleging fake votes and photographs, and claimed the BJP and EC are attacking the Constitution. Gandhi highlighted instances of multiple votes by one person and a Brazilian woman's photo being misused.

title: Exclusive | Humpy goes AWOL since WC final defeat: Where is she?
content: Divya Deshmukh clinched the Women's World Cup, becoming the first Indian to win the title. Meanwhile, seasoned campaigner Koneru Humpy took a well-deserved break to focus on family after the intense tournament. Humpy is now gearing up for a comeback in the Global Chess League and World Rapid and Blitz Championships.

title: Sidney Crosby future: GM Kyle Dubas makes firm call on Penguins captain
content: Pittsburgh Penguins GM Kyle Dubas has definitively stated that captain Sidney Crosby's future remains with the team. Dubas emphasized his commitment to building a contending roster around Crosby, with no plans to trade the veteran.  He believes continued success and winning are the best solutions for the team's long-term vision.

title: Jakarta: 55 hurt in multiple blasts inside school mosque; suspect identified
content: Multiple explosions rocked a mosque within a Jakarta high school complex during Friday prayers, injuring at least 55 people, mostly students. A 17-year-old suspect is undergoing surgery after being identified by authorities. The blasts caused panic, with victims suffering injuries primarily from glass shards.

title: 'Land theft': Rahul targets Maha govt over property scam; recalls 'vote theft charge
content: Rahul Gandhi has accused the Maharashtra government of land theft. He alleges government land worth ‚Çπ1,800 crore, meant for Dalits, was sold for ‚Çπ300 crore to a company linked to Ajit Pawar's son. Stamp duty was waived in the transaction. Gandhi claims this exposes corruption and that the government came to power through vote theft.

title: Hong Kong Sixes: Rain-hit thriller! India edge Pakistan by 2 runs (DLS)
content: India secured a thrilling two-run victory over Pakistan in a rain-affected Hong Kong Sixes 2025 match, decided by the DLS method. Robin Uthappa's explosive 28 off 11 balls set a competitive total, and Stuart Binny's economical bowling proved crucial in the narrow win.

title: Trump's claims inflated? China still has chokehold on rare earth; what officials say
content: China is introducing a new licensing system for rare earth exports, aiming for a faster and easier process. While this offers longer validity and potentially larger volumes, it does not remove existing restrictions, falling short of US expectations for a full rollback. The new permits are expected before year-end, but obtaining them may remain challenging for certain sectors.

title: BCCI vs PCB: Naqvi reaches Dubai for ICC meeting; Asia Cup trophy row on agenda
content: Pakistan Cricket Board chief Mohsin Naqvi has arrived in Dubai for the ICC Board meeting, where the BCCI is expected to raise the issue of the delayed Asia Cup trophy handover. BCCI Secretary Devajit Saikia reiterated their intention to escalate the matter to the ICC if the trophy isn't returned promptly.

title: Gujarat HC grants six month bail to Asaram on health grounds
content: Gujarat High Court granted six months' bail to Asaram, 82, on health grounds for medical treatment. He is serving a life sentence in a 2013 rape case. The court cited a similar directive from the Rajasthan High Court, which had also granted him bail for medical reasons.

title: 116-year-old world‚Äôs oldest living woman's secret to long life is not exercise but...
content: Ethel Caterham, now 116, holds the title of the world's oldest living person. Her secret to longevity isn't diet or exercise, but maintaining peace of mind by avoiding arguments and living by her own choices.

title: Watch: Man urinates outside Delhi's Red Fort metro; runs as foreign influencer shames him
content: A viral video captured a man urinating near Delhi's Red Fort metro station, sparking outrage and debate. Foreign influencer and local volunteers confronted the individual, highlighting a lack of civic sense. The incident reignites discussions on public hygiene and the effectiveness of shaming as a deterrent, emphasising the urgent need for greater public awareness.

title: Zarine Khan, mother of Sussanne Khan and Zayed Khan, passes away at 81
content: The Bollywood fraternity is mourning the loss of a revered figure, Zarine Khan (Zarin Katrak), wife of veteran actor Sanjay Khan and mother of actor Zayed Khan, designer Sussanne Khan and Farah Khan Ali. Zarine Khan passed away peacefully today, surrounded by her family. She was 81 years old.

title: Aishwarya was sent a tax notice: Here is how she won the Rs 4 cr case
content: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan won a Rs 4 crore tax case against the Income Tax Department. The ITAT Mumbai ruled in her favor, stating the Assessing Officer failed to properly justify rejecting her voluntary disallowance of Rs 49 lakh. The tribunal found her calculations reasonable and noted inconsistencies in the department's assessment.

title: Far from premium! Passenger finds cockroaches on Gwalior‚ÄìBhopal Vande Bharat Express
content: A passenger on the Vande Bharat Express discovered cockroaches on his seat during a journey from Gwalior to Bhopal. He shared a video online, sparking concerns about hygiene. Railway officials have ordered an investigation into the incident. This marks the first such complaint for the premium train service. The railway administration is taking the matter seriously.

title: Man ends life after video of him urinating in public goes viral
content: A 27-year-old man tragically ended his life after facing relentless online harassment and threats over a video. Despite apologizing, the sustained trolling led him to take the extreme step. Police have registered an FIR against seven individuals for abetment of suicide and circulating the damaging content.

title: Influencer walks Tokyo streets in socks; viral test stuns internet
content: A viral experiment saw a Japanese influencer walk Tokyo's streets in white socks, proving their remarkable cleanliness. This demonstration highlights Japan's deep-rooted civic responsibility and community-driven habits, where residents carry their trash, leading to spotless public spaces. The act underscores that cleanliness thrives on collective behaviour, not just infrastructure, captivating global viewers.

title: It‚Äôs all meaningless: Why prestige no longer satisfies young talent; culture matters
content: Many young professionals are rethinking their career choices. The allure of prestigious Big 4 firms like PwC, Deloitte, EY, and KPMG is fading. Employees report long hours, slow promotions, and a feeling of being undervalued. This trend reflects a broader shift where younger generations prioritize work-life balance, meaningful work, and genuine growth over brand names alone.

title: 'Lalu's son will open Apaharan dept': Shah cautions Bihar voters; raises 'jungle raj' spectre
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah warned Bihar voters against the opposition Mahagathbandhan, alleging they would establish an "Apaharan (kidnapping) ministry" if they win. He contrasted this with the NDA's promise to make Bihar flood-free and asserted that lawlessness would not return under their rule.

title: ‚ÄòThey came from ponds': 40 crocodiles rescued from Haridwar homes and fields
content: Freshwater crocodiles, mostly juveniles, have been rescued from homes and farmlands in Haridwar and Laksar this monsoon, causing fear among residents. Officials believe these reptiles, now adults, originated from local ponds and reservoirs, entering residential areas in search of food.  Villagers are concerned for their children's safety and have requested that rescued crocodiles not be released back into the Ganga.

title: Mumbai terror trail: Flats once used for 1993 blasts meeting to be auctioned
content: Properties linked to 1993 Mumbai blasts accused Tiger Memon and his family, including a conspiracy meeting site, are slated for auction. Authorities have seized eight properties, with more in legal processes. Valuations are underway for these assets, with auctions anticipated in December or January, offering a glimpse into the aftermath of the devastating attacks.

title: Air India crash: SC tells pilot‚Äôs father ‚Äòyou shouldn‚Äôt carry burden on yourself‚Äô
content: The Supreme Court has stated that the pilot-in-command of the Air India Boeing Dreamliner that crashed in Ahmedabad, killing 260 people, is not to be blamed. The apex court assured the pilot's 91-year-old father that his son is not at fault, calling the incident an accident. A notice was issued to the Centre and DGCA regarding the father's plea for a fair investigation.

title: Vande Mataram song row: PM Modi says key stanzas removed in 1937; Kharge hits out at BJP, RSS
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi accused the 1937 Congress government of removing stanzas from Vande Mataram, claiming it fractured the song and sowed seeds of partition. He emphasized the song's enduring inspiration for nation-building and highlighted India's civilisational ethos of the nation as a mother and Shakti.

title: Delhi chokes again: AQI at 311 with 26 of 38 stations in ‚Äòvery poor zone
content: Delhi's air quality plunged into the 'very poor' category on Friday, with the city-wide AQI hitting 311. Bawana recorded the highest pollution levels at 366. Meanwhile, the minimum temperature dipped to 12.7¬∞C, and shallow fog is expected to persist, impacting visibility across the capital.

title: Jubilee Hills bypolls: Bandi Sanjay slams CM Revanth Reddy for skull cap; sparks row
content: Union minister Bandi Sanjay sparked controversy during a poll rally, urging Hindus to unite and accusing Congress and AIMIM of appeasement politics. He criticized leaders for perceived religious gestures for votes and alleged a plot to turn Telangana into an Islamic state, calling for a Hindu vote-bank.

title: Expert picks, best bets: How Randy Brown could get an upset win at UFC Fight Night
content: welterweight title fight tops next week's UFC 322 fight card . Neither Brown nor Bonfim are ranked in the MMA divisional rankings . the first of two consecutive weeks of main events takes place on saturday .

title: Last-minute pickups for Week 10: What will it take for Darnold to get more love?
content: every Friday throughout the 2025 season, Matt Bowen will offer some late-week pickup options to fill those holes . this column will focus mostly on players rostered in fewer than 50% of ESPN leagues, with occasional exceptions .

title: NHL Power Rankings: Every team's current pace vs. preseason projections
content: a panel of ESPN hockey commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on the games through Wednesday . this edition of the Power Rankings will be taking a look at the preseason over/under point totals compared to each team's current points pace .

title: Why was Ja Morant suspended? What we know about the latest Grizzlies drama
content: grizzlies guard Ja Morant is frustrated with his joy for the game of basketball . the Grizzlies are frustrated, too, suspending Morant for a game over the weekend because of conduct detrimental to the team . morant missed the loss to the Toronto Raptors on Sunday, then had 18 points .

title: How to watch ESPN amid Disney-YouTube TV blackout
content: the blackout affects ABC, the ESPN networks, the Disney-branded channels, Freeform, the FX networks and the Xfinity network . the conflict affects the channel's ability to carry Disney programming . if you don't have cable access, you can get instant access to ESPN content through a variety of services including Cox, Dish, DirecTV, Fios, Fubo, Hulu + Live TV, Mediacom, Optimum, Sling, Spectrum TV and

title: Our guide to every Week 10 game: Matchup previews, predictions, and nuggets
content: the NFL schedule for the 2025 season brings some exciting matchups . the game will be played between the Falcons and Colts in the u.s. back in the states, Drake Maye and Baker Mayfield will face off in a QB duel .

title: Don't be surprised if ... Lamar Jackson, Rashid Shaheed thrive down the stretch
content: Rashid Shaheed averaged 11.6 fantasy points, on pace for 83 receptions and 943 receiving yards . Shaheed was a reasonable, deep-league flex option who simply needed better quarterback play . he averaged an ordinary 11.3 yards per catch with QBs Spencer Rattler .

title: Inter-State burglar arrested in Bengaluru
content: a 30-year-old inter-State burglar has been arrested . he was allegedly involved in two house break-in thefts in different parts of the country . the e-Paper was updated - November 07, 2025 08:33 pm IST .
